snippet: New tensions between the meeting’s sponsors, Russia and the United States, appeared to complicate the negotiations.
abstract: Frustrations mount in Geneva as the second round of Syrian peace talks draws near a close without breaking a weeklong deadlock.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, Rick Gladstone from New York, Michael R. Gordon from Beijing, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: New tensions between the meeting’s sponsors, Russia and the United States, appeared to complicate the negotiations.

headline.main: Deadlock Remains and Aid Crisis Mounts as 2nd Round of Syria Talks Nears End
headline.print_headline: Deadlock Remains and Aid Crisis Mounts as 2nd Round of Syria Talks Nears End
